result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

9:05 AM Defendant Davon H. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Devonte D. Windham in court for Davon H. Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W. Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moved to find counts 1 & 2 transactionally related. Court found counts 1 & 2 transactionally related. Law Enforcement officer Michael Mawhinney duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - made argument; Court binds case over; bail continued.

10:20 AM Defendant Davon H Johnson in court.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Davon H Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.   set for prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Davon H Johnson in court.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke for Tracy L McMiller in court for State of Wisconsin. Time limits previously waived; SPD has not yet appt'd.  Set STC in 30 days. DE given notice in hand.
08:49 AM, Defn contacted BR 11 to advise he would be late for 8:30 hearing.  PH is with BR 15.  Info relayed to duty judge
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:13 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defn Davon H Johnson appears without counsel. Atty Certified Intern Kevin McGhee appears under the supervision of Atty Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on attempts to retain counsel. TLW. Court finds good cause to set over to allow for defendant to obtain counsel.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Abigail P. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

01:47 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
